Did you make your own vegetables? Yes
First you first. You can't remember cooking molds? In the store, bulk, 10 lb. bought at amounts easily, each time.

Remember all your ingredients and anything needed in the last day or two. Remember to use the ingredients by the end of the week. Never throw away any unused ingredients.

Next, you need to make sure you have enough sugar and flour for your recipes. Make sure you have enough eggs and milk for your breakfasts.

Don't forget to check your pantry for any expired items. If you find any, throw them out immediately.

Finally, make sure you have enough vegetables and fruits for your meals. Keep them in the refrigerator to keep them fresh.

Remember to always wash your hands before and after handling food. This helps prevent the spread of germs.

Also, make sure you have enough cleaning supplies for your house. Keep them in a convenient place so you can easily access them when needed.

Lastly, don't forget to take care of yourself. Make sure you get enough sleep and exercise to keep yourself healthy and happy.

19. Are you ever refused to almost starvation level living on our or two locally produced foods? Give details.

We were never refused food during the war years. We had plenty to eat and were able to help others who needed it.

We worked hard to save money to buy food for those in need. We always tried to help others when we could.

We always looked out for each other and helped each other when needed. We were able to provide for ourselves and others during the war years.
